description.text: [Description]: This element configures storage information for persistent message.
[Description]:
[Description]: This element is destination name in which Durable Subscriber receives message.
[Description]: In case of establishing connection from this connection by Factory client, thread pool information on this connection is set.
[Description]: This configures whether to apply SSL to server channel.
[Description]: This element configures maximum size of thread pool.
[Description]: This element selects Queue clustering method.
[Description]: This element configures file storage in case of using file storage.
[Description]: This element configures message table name used in JMS.
[Description]: This configures maximum number of client in which server channel allows. In case of using blocking socket,it can not exceed the maximum number of threads set in message broker.

[Description]: Specify name of the broker routing the incoming message to this destination. Unless specified, the message will be routed to the destination of the server that connected to connection factory. If specified, even though the destination is connected to another clustering server, the messages sent by the procedure in this destination will be routed to the specified broker, but not to the destination of connected server. Please do not use this option for clustering destination.
[Description]: Option to use embedded DB as storage.
[Description]: This element is ip-address of related JMS message broker.
[Description]:This is configuration on service channel for providing messaging service. Minimum one should be configured.
[Description]: This element configures memory size starting soft caching.
[Description]: This element configures XA table name used in JMS.
[Description]: This is name of service channel. This is used for configuring channel information in Connection Factory.
[Description]: This element is service port number of related server channel. [Example]: 9741
[Description]: This element configures minimum size of thread pool.
[Description]: For thread which has not been used for set time period and exceeds min number, thread will be destroyed.
[Description]: This element selects topic clustering method.

[Description]: When the connection with client has been abruptly terminated, this is the time period in which it will wait for reconnection. After time period has been passed, it will return the resource to the server.
[Description]: This is name used for communicating between clusters. JMS message broker taking part in clustering should contain unique value.
[Description]: The top level element inside JMSMain.xml. Token or String values can not include following strings. ':', ',', '*', '?', '='
[Description]: This element configures destination table name used in JMS.
[Description]: Backlog size of service port.
[Description]: This element configures information on connection factory.
[Description]: The size of network buffer reading message from client. The default value is 64K.
[Description]: Determine the policy to select the channel when ConnectionFactory creates connection.
[Description]: This element is ClientID value being set as default value in generated conection using related Connection Factory.
[Description]: This element configures JMS message broker participating in here in case of using destination clustering.
[Description]: Size of network buffer for transmitting message to Client. The default value is 64K.
[Description]: Configure clustering type for clustering topic.
[Description]: This element configures service name for communcation between clusterings. If it is not set, it is temporarily configured.
[Description]: This is full file path in which file storage is located.
[Description]: This value is used in case of using message distribution mode of server-weighted mode.
[Description]:This element is configuration on thread pool in which JMS message broker uses.
[Description]: This element configures subscription table name used in JMS.
[Description]:In case of using blocking socket, it terminates the connection when there is no request from client for the set time. The default value is 120 minutes.
[Description]: It enhances the importnace of message processed in local broker. This is only meaningful in case where either of server-weighted or consumer-weighted mode is used.

[Description]: This tag configures value determining client. Entire client-id values within durable-subscriber element should not be duplicated not only in connection-factory element but also in durable-subscirber element.
[Description]: This element is service prot value of JMS message broker.

[Description]: IP address of related server channel is directly configured. This is used as address value for connecting to client. If it is not set, "127.0.0.1" will be used. [Example]: 123.123.123.123
[Description]: Specify the variables for SSL.
[Description]: Configuring information on connection factory.
[Description]: This element configures the range of connection factory. If it is set as true, it will be used as cluster factory.
[Description]: This element is the name of Connection Factory used for management purpose in JMS System.
[Description]: Name in which Connection Factory is binded in naming server. If it has not been set, name property will be used as it is.
[Description]: This element is the destination name used for management purpose within JMS message broker.
[Description]: It determines whether to use blocking socket or non-blocking-socket for JMS server It is recommended to use non-blocking socket.
[Description]: This element configures message selector of Durable Subscriber.
[Description]: This element configures database storage in case of using database storage.
[Description]: This element configures name of datasource to be binded in JNDI to be used.
[Description]:This element configures inforamtion on access log.
[Description]: This element configures information on Durable subscriber.

[Description]: This element is broker id used for communication among clusters. JMS Message broker taking part in cluster should contain each unique value. If the value has not been set, it can be temporaily configured according to set order in cluster table.
[Description]:This element is name of JMS message broker. If it is not set, host name is used.
[Description]: Limit the number of consumers for accessing to destination.
[Description]: It determines whether to do message distribution of queue destination set as multiple-receiver. One of round-robin or random can be configured.
[Description]: This element configures memory size starting to use flow control.

[Description]: This element configures name of service attempting to be connected by Connection Factory. Name set in service-config is used. In case where name is not set, it is configured as initially set service.
[Description]: This is method of delivering message to cluster server set above. Either of non-durable or durable can be configured.
[Description]: This element configures type of related destination. Select either of queue or topic.
[Description]: Configure clustering type for queue clustering.
[Description]: This element configures information on JMS message broker taking part in Cluster.
[Description]: Select set clustering type as topic-cluster.
[Description]: This element configures broker name participating in clustering. Related name should be name set in jms-server-info.
[Description]: Name for related destination to be binded into naming server. If it is not set, name property is used as it is.
[Description]: This element configures information on destination.
[Description]: This element configures maximum memory size can be used in related destination. In case where used memory exceeds this value, message delivering of client will process as an error.
[Description]: This element configures broker name participating in clustering. Related name should be name set in jms-server-info.
[Description]: Configure method for distributing message in each broker participating in queue clustering. One of server-weighted, consumer-weighted, round-robin or random can be set.
[Description]: Select clustering type set as queue-cluster.
[Description]: This element is the name of Durable Subscriber used for management purpose within message broker.
[Description]: Specify whether to allow multiple receivers for the distributed processing of queue type destination.

[Description]: Specifies whether authority checks are to be performed for client activities. If set to true, only users that have createConnection authority for jeus.jms.client.connectionFactory will be able to connect to this service channel. Also only users that have createDestination authority for jeus.jms.destination.creation will be able to to dynamically add destinations to JMS message broker while it is running.
[Description]: Specifies the URL for the service channel. Set this item to 'oneport' for a 1-port service channel, and set to 'tcp://host:port' for a 'tcp' channels.

[Description]:If MessageListener is registered in Queue or Topic, incoming messages will be sent to Consumer as soon as they arrive at Destination. Thus the client will have to handle these messages quickly or they will accumulate in memory and an OutOfMemory error will occur. This problem can be prevented by specifying the maximum allowable number of messages to be dispatched to applications without receiving an ACK message.

[Description]: If the number of messages in the PENDING queue is higher than specified in max-pending-limit, message transmissions will temporarily be suspended. If the number of messages in the PENDING queue drops to the the number specified in (max-pending-limit * resume-dispatch-factor)or less, after the client had completed message processing and had sent an ACKNOWLGE, message transmission will resume.
[Description]: Specifies the level of reliability for storing messages.
[Description]: Specifies whether the destination, recovered from storage but not specified in JMSMain.xml, is to be removed when the engine is started.
[Description]: Specifies the path for embedded DB storage.
[Description]: Specifies the name of the table for storing destination information.
[Description]: Specifies the name of the table for storing durable subscriber information.
[Description]: Specifies the name of the table for storing message information.
[Description]: Specifies the name of the table for storing user information.
[Description]: Specifies the name of the table for storing durable message information.
[Description]: Specifies the name of the table for storing XA information.
[Description]: Specifies the wait time for SQLCommandExecutor, which implements database tasks in the background, to retrieve SQL commands from the SQL Queue.
[Description]: Specifies whether to wait for the jobs in the SQL Queue to finish before terminating SQLCommandExecutor.
[Description]: This option should be set to true if JMS Service Channel provides services to OnePort Transport. ip-address and jms-port should be the base ports of JEUSManager or the EngineContainer.
[Description]: Specifies the configuration of SSL.
[Description]:Sets the interval for connecting with other cluster servers.

[Description]: Sends messages in storage but does not log inforamtion when the messages are sent to consumers. If an ACKNOWLEDGE that a consumer has sent could not be handled due to storage failure, it will be marked as unstransmitted and can be resent when the failure is corrected.

[Description]: Sends messages in storage and logs inforamtion when the messages are sent to consumers. If an ACKNOWLEDGE that a consumer has sent could not be handled due to storage failure, it will be marked as transmitted and will be stored in the pending queue of the destination. Messages in the pending queue can be deleted or retransmitted by an administrator.
